title: Fact Check-Image doesn't show 400 jets flown to Glasgow for COP26 |
htmlTitle: Fact Check-Image doesn't show 400 jets flown to Glasgow for COP26 |
snippet: Nov 3, 2021 ... An image showing parked jets at an airport has been miscaptioned by ... by world-leaders to fly to the U.N. COP26 climate change conference ...
htmlSnippet: Nov 3, 2021 ... An image showing parked jets at an airport has been miscaptioned by ... by world-leaders to fly to the U.N. COP26 climate change conference ...

metatags.twitter:creator: @Reuters
metatags.og:description: An image showing parked jets at an airport has been miscaptioned by social media users, who claim it shows 400 jets used by world-leaders to fly to the U.N. COP26 climate change conference held in the Scottish city of Glasgow.

title: Strategies to achieve a carbon neutral society: a review | SpringerLink

snippet: Apr 8, 2022 ... Moreover, to achieve net-zero carbon emissions and sustainable ... and COP26 is the 26th United Nations Climate Change Conference of the ...

metatags.dc.title: Strategies to achieve a carbon neutral society: a review
metatags.citation_title: Strategies to achieve a carbon neutral society: a review
metatags.twitter:title: Strategies to achieve a carbon neutral society: a review
metatags.dc.description: The increasing global industrialization and over-exploitation of fossil fuels has induced the release of greenhouse gases, leading to an increase in global temperature and causing environmental issues. There is therefore an urgent necessity to reach net-zero carbon emissions. Only 4.5% of countries have achieved carbon neutrality, and most countries are still planning to do so by 2050–2070. Moreover, synergies between different countries have hampered synergies between adaptation and mitigation policies, as well as their co-benefits. Here, we present a strategy to reach a carbon neutral economy by examining the outcome goals of the 26th summit of the United Nations Climate Change Conference of the Parties (COP 26). Methods have been designed for mapping carbon emissions, such as input–output models, spatial systems, geographic information system maps, light detection and ranging techniques, and logarithmic mean divisia. We present decarbonization technologies and initiatives, and negative emissions techno

metatags.og:description: Britain is asking countries to push for a global target to cut aviation emissions to levels compatible with the Paris Agreement, under a deal due to be announced at the COP26 climate change summit, according to a draft document seen by Reuters.

metatags.og:description: Some activists at COP26 will be urging others to cut down on air travel, but apparently it is fine for billionaires to fly in on their own planes on routes already served by commercial airlines.
metatags.mol:headline: Hypocrite airways? Jeff Bezos's £48m Gulf Stream leads parade of 400 private jets into COP26 including Prince Albert of Monaco, scores of royals and dozens of 'green' CEOs - as huge traffic jam forces empty planes to fly 30 miles to park

videoobject.name: Hundreds queue as mass crowds descend on Glasgow for COP26
videoobject.description: Hundreds queue to enter COP26 'Blue Zone' in Glasgow as some call for a 'better plan' to get into the venue with covid restrictions.

videoobject.name: Boris Johnson: Countries responsible for emissions not doing enough
videoobject.description: Boris Johnson says countries responsible for emissions not doing their fair share. He spoke at the G20 summit in Italy.

videoobject.name: Extinction Rebellion protest outside JP Morgan in Glasgow
videoobject.description: Climate activists from Extinction Rebellion staged a protest outside the JP Morgan office in Glasgow in the light of the climate emergency and COP26.

videoobject.name: Liz Truss defends world leaders arriving at Cop26 on private planes
videoobject.description: Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has defended world leaders flying on private planes to Glasgow for the Cop26 climate summit as she stressed the importance of having these meetings face to face.

videoobject.name: Joe Biden meets Italian PM in Rome for G20 summit on climate change
videoobject.description: US President Joe Biden meets Italian Prime Minister Mario Draghi in Rome as leaders arrive for the two-day G20 summit on climate change which precedes the COP26 climate change summit.
